packagegui.name: bind
packagegui.title: BIND: DNS Settings

field.sethelp: Disable DNS Forwarder and Resolver services on selected interfaces before enabling BIND.

field.description:
Select IP transport version.
This controls which transports are used when resolving queries.
Choose the interfaces on which to enable BIND.
Notify slave server after any update on master.
Hide the version of BIND (ignore queries for version.bind).
Limits RAM use for DNS server (Recommended: 256M)
Enable BIND logs under Status > System logs, Resolver tab.

Choose logging level for selected categories.
The value 'dynamic' means assume the global level defined by either the command line parameter -d or by running rndc trace.

Select categories to log.
(Use CTRL + click to select/unselect.

option.name: Default - If this is the only category selected, it will log all categories except queries.
General - Anything that is not classified as any other item in this list defaults to this category.
Database - Messages relating to the databases used internally by the name server to store zone and cache data.
Security - Approval and denial of requests.
Config - Configuration file parsing and processing.
Resolver - Name resolution including recursive lookups.
Xfer-in - Details of zone transfers the server is receiving.
Xfer-out - Details of zone transfers the server is sending.
Unmatched - No matching view clause or unrecognized class value.
Update - Logging of all dynamic update (DDNS) transactions.
Dispatch - Dispatching of incoming packets to the server modules.
DNSSEC - DNSSEC and TSIG protocol processing.
lame-servers - Misconfiguration in the delegation of domains discovered by BIND.

field.sethelp: See A Quick Introduction to Response Rate Limiting to prevent DOS attack.

field.description: Select what to do when a query reaches a limit.
Enable forwarding queries to other DNS servers listed below rather than this server performing its own recursion.

Enter IPs of DNS servers to use for recursion. Separate by semi-colons (;).
Please also add a semi-colon (;) behind the last entry
Applies only if Enable Forwarding is chosen.

TCP and UDP port BIND listens for queries on. Remember to create firewall rules to allow queries on this port.
Must be changed if also running DNS Forwarder or Resolver on this Firewall.

TCP port BIND listens for control requests on (localhost only).
Must be changed if also running DNS Forwarder or Resolver on this Firewall.

You can put your own custom options here, one per line. They'll be added to the configuration.
They need to be named.conf native settings.

You can put your own global settings here. They'll be added to the configuration.
They need to be named.conf native settings.
